A Simple Post

This is a minimal article with no metadata at all. It only has an H1 and a few paragraphs. Despite the lack of metadata, the content extractor should still be able to identify this as an article and extract the main content reliably using DOM heuristics.

The extraction pipeline tries readability-lxml first, then trafilatura, and finally falls back to DOM-based heuristics that score block elements by paragraph density.

Even without JSON-LD, Open Graph tags, or other structured metadata, the article scorer should assign a reasonable score based on the presence of an H1, sufficient word count, and paragraph structure.

This test fixture validates that the scraper works even on bare-bones HTML blogs without any structured metadata.
